name: Whole Spicy Smoked Roast Chicken From 'Pitt Cue Co.: The Cookbook'
description: This chicken won the Fourth of July. The recipe, from Pitt Cue Co.: The Cookbook, sounded delicious on the page: A whole bird, rested overnight in chipotle and garlic pastes, maple syrup, butter, and Pitt Cue's aromatic, spicy-sweet House Rub, then slow-smoked until perfectly burnished. Yes, please.

recipeInstructions.text: Blitz the chipotle chile paste, butter, maple syrup, roasted garlic paste, and house rub in a blender to a paste. Make slashes about 1/2 inch deep in the thighs of the chicken with a sharp knife, then rub the chicken thoroughly inside and out with the paste. Put it into a dish, cover, and leave overnight in the fridge.
Prepare a barbecue for smoking and set the temperature to 300°F.

Put the chicken, breast-side up, into a roasting pan that will fit inside your barbecue and smoke/roast for 1 1/2 hours, or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 158°F and the juices run clear when the chicken is pricked with a knife at the thickest point of the thigh area.
Remove the chicken from the barbecue and let rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with a green salad.
